core.grammar
Interface Grammar

All Known Subinterfaces:
StochasticContextFreeGrammar
All Known Implementing Classes:
GrammarImpl, StochasticContextFreeGrammarImpl
public interface Grammar

The inteface declares the methods that define the responsabilities of a general Grammar. At this level should be declared the methods that are responsability of the Grammar, por example, the derivation of a Production is responsability of the Grammar that knows all the productions and Symbols that define the Grammar, it isn´t a responsability of a Production for example. It belongs to the Public API.

Author:
Jorge Couchet

Method Detail

setIdMax

void setIdMax(int idMax)
Sets the maximum ID associated with the Elements of the Grammar (NonTerminals, Terminals and Productions)

Parameters:
idMax - The maximum ID used in the Grammar, then if a new Element is created, its ID will be idMax + 1.

getIdMax

int getIdMax()
Returns the maximum ID associated to the Grammar.

getNonTerminal

NonTerminal getNonTerminal(NonTerminal nt)
If the NonTerminal nt is associated to the Grammar returns the NonTerminal object that has the ID = nt.getID, otherwise returns NULL.

Parameters:
nt - The NonTerminal that is necessary to know if belongs to the Grammar. It only need to have a value in the ID field.

getNonTerminal

NonTerminal getNonTerminal(int id)
Returns the NonTerminal object that has the id = "id", otherwise returns NULL.

Parameters:
id - The NonTerminal's id that is necessary to know if belongs to the Grammar.

getNonTerminal

Returns the NonTerminal object that has the symbol = "symbol", otherwise returns NULL.

Parameters:
symbol - The NonTerminal's symbol that is necessary to know if belongs to the Grammar.

getNonTerminals

java.util.Collection<NonTerminal> getNonTerminals()
Returns the NonTerminals associated to the Grammar as a Collection.

setNonTerminal

NonTerminal setNonTerminal(NonTerminal nt)
                           throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Associates the NonTerminal nt to the Grammar. The method returns NULL if the ID of nt doesn´t collide with other ID. If there is a collision, then the new nt replace the old_nt, and the method returns the old_nt. Throws a GrammarExceptionImpl if the NonTerminal is NULL.

Parameters:
nt - The new NonTerminal symbol to be associated to the Grammar.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

If the Terminal t is associated to the Grammar returns the Terminal object that has the ID = t.getID, otherwise returns NULL.

Parameters:
t - The Terminal that is necessary to know if belongs to the Grammar. It only need to have a value in the ID field.

setTerminal

Terminal setTerminal(Terminal t)
                     throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Associates the Terminal t to the Grammar. The method returns NULL if the ID of t doesn´t collide with other ID. If there is a collision, then the new t replace the old_t, and the method returns the old_t. Throws a GrammarExceptionImpl if the Terminal is NULL.

Parameters:
t - The new Terminal symbol to be associated to the Grammar.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

getProduction

Production getProduction(Production p)
If the Production p is associated to the Grammar returns the Production object that has the ID = p.getID, otherwise returns NULL.

Parameters:
p - The production that is necessary to know if belongs to the Grammar. It only need to have a value in the ID field.

getProductions

java.util.Collection<Production> getProductions()
Returns the Productions associated to the Grammar as a Collection.

setProduction

void setProduction(Production p)
                   throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Associates the Production p with the Grammar. The method must check first that the NonTerminal and Terminal symbols that are in the Production are associated to the Grammar, if it isn´t the case then the method must associate first these symbols to the Grammar. The method must call the methods setRelations of the NonTerminals and Terminals objects. The method throws a GrammarException if the Production is NULL or there were any collision.

Parameters:
p - The new production to be associated to the Grammar.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

setProduction

void setProduction(Production p,
                   java.util.Collection<Element> l,
                   Element leftSide)
                   throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

getStart

NonTerminal getStart()
Return the Start symbol of the Grammar.

setStart

void setStart(NonTerminal nt)
              throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Sets Start symbol of the Grammar. Throws a GrammarExceptionImpl if the NonTerminal is NULL.

Parameters:
nt - The NonTerminal symbol that is the Start symbol of the Grammar.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

calculateLengthNonTerminals

void calculateLengthNonTerminals()
                                 throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Calculates and stores the length of each NonTerminal of the Grammar. It's necessary to take care of to have associated all the Productions to the Grammar before the calculation of the length of the NonTerminals (because is possible that theirs lengths depends of the others Productions). Only works if the method hasCalculatedLengthsNonTerminals == FALSE. Throws a GrammarException if there the Grammar is NULL, of the Grammar doesn't has NonTerminals symbols, or doesn't has a start symbol, or there is any problem in the calculation of the lengths of the NonTerminals.

Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

calculateLengthProductions

void calculateLengthProductions()
                                throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Calculates and stores the length of each Production of the Grammar. It's necessary to take care of to have associated all the Productions to the Grammar before the calculation of the length of the Productions (because is possible that theirs lengths depends of the others Productions). Only works if the method hasCalculatedLengthsProductions == FALSE. Throws a GrammarException if there the Grammar is NULL, of the Grammar doesn't has Productions symbols, or doesn't has a start symbol, or there is any problem with the calculation of the lengths of the NonTerminals.

Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

calculateLenghtNonTerminal

int calculateLenghtNonTerminal(NonTerminal nt)
                               throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Calculates the length of the NonTerminal nt of the Grammar. It's necessary to take care of to have associated all the Productions to the Grammar before call this method (because is possible that its length depends of the others Productions). Returns -2 if the Grammar is NULL or the NonTerminal nt doesn´t belong to the Grammar. Returns -1 if the NonTerminal nt doesn´t have associated Productions (an associated Production is a Production that have nt at the left side). Returns the lenght of the NonTerminal nt if the above conditions are´nt fullfiled. Throws a GrammarException if there is a problem in the calculation of the lenght, or if there is an infinite loop with the Productions that are associated to the NonTerminal nt.

Parameters:
nt - The NonTerminal that will be used for the length calculation.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

calculateMinimumDepth

int calculateMinimumDepth()
                          throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Returns the Grammar's minimum depth. The length of the Grammar's axiom (S) establishes the minimum size of a derivation tree.

Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

calculateLenghtProduction

int calculateLenghtProduction(Production p)
                              throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Calculates (doesn´t store) the length of the Production p of the Grammar. It's necessary to take care of to have associated all the Productions to the Grammar before call this method (because is possible that its length depends of the others Productions). Returns -2 if the Grammar is NULL or the Production p doesn´t belong to the Grammar. Returns -1 if the Production p doesn´t have associated NonTerminals (an associated NonTerminals is a NonTerminal that is at the right side of the Production). Returns the lenght of the Production p if the above conditions are´nt fullfiled. Throws a GrammarException if the Production doesn´t has right symbols, or there is a problem in the calculation of the lenght, or if there is an infinite loop.

Parameters:
p - The Production that will be used for the length calculation.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

getLenghtProduction

int getLenghtProduction(Production p)
Returns the length associated to the Production p. If the Production isn´t in the Grammar returns a negative value.

Parameters:
p - The Production that is necessary to know his length.

getLenghtNonTerminal

int getLenghtNonTerminal(NonTerminal nt)
Returns the length associated to the NonTerminal nt. If the NonTerminal isn´t in the Grammar returns a negative value.

Parameters:
nt - The NonTerminal that is necessary to know his length.

setLenghtProduction

int setLenghtProduction(Production p,
                        int l)
                        throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Stores (it doesn´t make any calculation) the length of the Production p of the Grammar. The method returns a negative if the ID of p doesn´t collide with other ID. If there is a collision, then the new lenght replace the old_lenght, and the method returns the old_lenght of the Production that collides. Throws a GrammarExceptionImpl if the Production is NULL.

Parameters:
p - The Production that will be associated with the length l.
l - The actual length of the Production p.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

setLenghtNonTerminal

int setLenghtNonTerminal(NonTerminal nt,
                         int l)
                         throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Stores (it doesn´t make any calculation) the length of the NonTerminal p of the Grammar. The method returns a negative if the ID of nt doesn´t collide with other ID. If there is a collision, then the new lenght replace the old_lenght, and the method returns the old_lenght of the NonTerminal that collides. Throws a GrammarExceptionImpl if the NonTerminal is NULL.

Parameters:
nt - The NonTerminal that will be associated with the length l.
l - The actual length of the NonTerminal nt.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

getRandomDerivation

Derivation getRandomDerivation()
Returns a random Derivation of the Grammar starting from the Start symbol.

getRandomDerivation

Derivation getRandomDerivation(Production p)
Returns a random Derivation of the Grammar starting from the Production p. Take care because it isn´t a complete Derivation (that is: the Derivation doesn´t start with the Start symbol, unless the NonTerminal symbol at the left side of the Production == Start symbol).

Parameters:
p - The Production p that is derivated until a Derivation is obtained.

getRandomDerivation

Derivation getRandomDerivation(NonTerminal nt)
Returns a random Derivation of the Grammar starting from the NonTerminal nt. Take care because it isn´t a complete Derivation (that is: the Derivation doesn´t start with the Start symbol, unless nt == Start symbol).

Parameters:
nt - The symbol from whom the derivation stars.

getRandomDerivationMaxLenght

Derivation getRandomDerivationMaxLenght(int l)
Returns a random Derivation of the Grammar starting from the Start symbol and that satisfies the restriction that its length is at the most l. l= the maximum length from the root symbol (the Start in this case) of the Derivation until one of its Terminal symbol. If it isn´t possible to fulfill the restriction then returns NULL.

Parameters:
l - The number that imposes the length restriction.

getRandomDerivationMaxLenght

Derivation getRandomDerivationMaxLenght(Production p,
                                        int l)
Returns a random Derivation of the Grammar starting from the Production p and that satisfies the restriction that its length is at the most l. Take care because it isn´t a complete Derivation (that is: the Derivation doesn´t start with the Start symbol, unless the NonTerminal symbol at the left side of the Production == Start symbol). l= the maximum length from the root symbol (the Start in this case) of the Derivation until one of its Terminal symbols. If it isn´t possible to fulfill the restriction then returns NULL.

Parameters:
p - The Production p that is derivated until a Derivation is obtained.
l - The number that imposes the length restriction.

getRandomDerivationMaxLenght

Derivation getRandomDerivationMaxLenght(NonTerminal nt,
                                        int l)
Returns a random Derivation of the Grammar starting from the NonTerminal nt and that satisfies the restriction that its length is at the most l. Take care because it isn´t a complete Derivation (that is: the Derivation doesn´t start with the Start symbol, unless nt == Start symbol). If it isn´t possible to fulfill the restriction then returns NULL.

Parameters:
nt - The symbol from whom the Derivation starts.
l - The number that imposes the length restriction.

areThereTerminals

Returns TRUE if the Grammar has Terminals associated, FALSE otherwise.

boolean areThereNonTerminals()
Returns TRUE if the Grammar has NonTerminals associated, FALSE otherwise.

hasCalculatedLenghtsProductions

boolean hasCalculatedLenghtsProductions()

hasCalculatedLenghtsNonTerminals

boolean hasCalculatedLenghtsNonTerminals()
Returns TRUE if the lenghts of the NonTerminals associated to the Grammar where calculated, FALSE otherwise.

grammarToGraph

void grammarToGraph(boolean resumed)
                    throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Maps the Grammar to a Graph.

Parameters:
resumed - If is TRUE is mapped to a resumed Graph, if is FALSE is mapped to a full Graph.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

drawGrammar

void drawGrammar()
Draws the Grammar using the Graph that maps it. It is necessary to call the method grammarToGraph before.

findProduction

Production findProduction(Production prod,
                          int pos,
                          NonTerminal nt)
                          throws GrammarExceptionImpl
The method looks for a Production that fulfills the following properties: a) The same NonTerminal symbol at the left side, AND b) A right side with the same lenght that the right side of prod, AND c) The same Elements at the right side, with the exception of the Element at the position pos, AND d) The Element at the position pos must be equal to the NonTerminal nt. If the method finds a Production with the properties of above, then it returns the Production, otherwise returns NULL.

Parameters:
prod - The Production that is used for the search.
pos - The position of the Production prod where must be the NonTerminal nt.
nt - The NonTerminal that must be in the position pos of the Production to look for.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

findProduction

boolean findProduction(Production p)
The method looks for a Production in the Grammar that fulfills the following conditions: a) There is a Production in the Grammar that has the same ID that p, OR b) There is a Production in the Grammar that has the same Symbol that p.

Parameters:
p - The Production that is used for the search
Returns:
TRUE if one of the conditions are fulfilled or FALSE if none of them are fulfilled.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

findProduction

boolean findProduction(int id)
The method looks for a Production in the Grammar that fulfills the condition that there is a Production in the Grammar that has its id equal to "id".

Parameters:
id - The Production's id that is used for the search
Returns:
TRUE if the condition is fulfilled or FALSE if isn't fulfilled.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

Parameters:

Returns:
TRUE if the condition is fulfilled or FALSE if isn't fulfilled.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

Parameters:
nt - The NonTerminal that is used for the search
Returns:
TRUE if one of the conditions are fulfilled or FALSE if none of them are fulfilled.
Throws:

createProduction

Production createProduction(java.lang.String symbol,
                            NonTerminal lnt,
                            java.util.Collection<Element> els)
                            throws GrammarExceptionImpl
The method creates a new Production and adds it to the Grammar.

Parameters:
symbol - The name of the Production.
lnt - The NonTerminal symbol at the left side of the Production.
els - The Terminal and NonTerminal symbols at the right side of the Producti,
Returns:
The new Production object created or NULL if it wasn't possible.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

updateProduction

Production updateProduction(java.lang.String symbol,
                            Element e,
                            int pos)
                            throws GrammarExceptionImpl
The method updates a Production associated to the Grammar. It changes the symbol at the position pos of the right side of the Production by the Element e.

Parameters:
symbol - The name of the Production in the Grammar.
e - The new Element to be associated to the Production.
pos - The position at the right side of the Production (the symbol that is here will be changed by e).
Returns:
The Production updated or NULL if it wasn't possible.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

compareProductions

void compareProductions(java.util.Collection<Production> R,
                        java.util.Collection<Element> X,
                        Production generateCrossoverNode,
                        int posRigth)
                        throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Compares each Production in R against the generateCrossoverNode Production. For each Production in R, first it looks that its right side have the same length that the right side of generateCrossoverNode, if fulfill this condition then checks that the symbols at any position (with the exception of the position posRigth), are equals to the symbols at the same position in the generateCrossoverNode Production. If these conditions aren´t fulfilled then this Production is deleted from R. For the Productions that aren´t deleted from R, their symbols at the position posRigth are added to X. Take care because only looks at the right side of the Productions of R, that is, doesn´t look that their lefts side agree with the left side of generateCrossoverNode. If this condition is needed, then must be checked before. The method throws an GrammarExceptionImpl if generateCrossoverNode doesn't have right symbols.

Parameters:
R - The Productions to be compared. R cannot be null or empty (in this case the method doesn´t do nothing).
X - The collection that will hold the symbols at the position posRight of the Productions of R that fulfill the above condition. X cannot be null (in this case the method doesn´t do nothing).
generateCrossoverNode - The Production against which the Productions of R are compared. It cannot be null (in this case the method doesn´t do nothing).
posRigth - The position of generateCrossoverNode against which the symbols at the same position on the Productions of R aren´t compared. It must be greater than zero (the position starts at one).
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

getElement

Element getElement(int id)
Returns the Element object that has the id = "id", otherwise returns NULL.

Parameters:
id - The Element's id that is necessary to know if belongs to the Grammar.

getElement

Element getElement(java.lang.String symbol)
Returns the Element object that has the symbol = "symbol", otherwise returns NULL.

Parameters:
symbol - The Element's symbol that is necessary to know if belongs to the Grammar.
